**Elevator Modernization, Laboratory Wing, AAFC Saskatoon Research and Development Centre**
==========================

**Reference Number:** 465-1-28-C49
**Publication Date:** April 17, 2023

**Request for Proposal**
------------------------

Agriculture and Agri-Food Canada (AAFC) invites qualified contractors to submit a proposal for the modernization of the traction elevator in the Laboratory Wing of the Saskatoon Research and Development Centre. The project involves replacing major components to enhance the safety and reliability of the elevator, while meeting the ASME A17.1/CSA B44-2013 code.

**Scope of Work:**
------------------

The scope of work for this project includes:

* Replacing all wiring and travellers
* Installing a gearless traction machine
* Replacing sheaves, landing systems, and other related components
* Upgrading the door operator, interlock, and pickup rollers
* Replacing fixtures, buttons, interior panels, flooring, and other related components

**Optional Work:**
------------------

The contractor may also be required to perform services for the modernization of the hydraulic elevator in the front lobby of the same building. This work includes:

* Replacing all wiring and travellers
* Installing a power pack, including a pump, motor, and valve
* Replacing hydraulic cylinders and buffers
* Upgrading the door operator, interlock, and pickup rollers

**Selection Criteria:**
----------------------

This is a two-phase selection process. The first phase will assess the qualifications and experience of the contractors, and the second phase will evaluate the pricing.

**Submission Requirements:**
-------------------------

* The electronic submission must be in PDF format, sent via email to aafc.wscprocurement-csoapprovisionnement.aac@agr.gc.ca
* The subject line of the email must identify the electronic submission and include the solicitation number
* The electronic submission must be received by the specified closing date and time

**Responsibility:**
------------------

The contractor is responsible for ensuring timely and correct delivery of electronic submissions. Canada will not assume responsibility for any failure attributable to the transmission or receipt of the bid, including but not limited to delay, illegibility, or security issues.

**Contact Information:**
------------------------

For further information, please refer to the attached tender documents. You can also contact Desta Kissack at desta.kissack@agr.gc.ca or (204) 583-8127.
